uk.ac.man.cs.mig.util.graph.graph

Interface Graph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultGraph

    public interface Graph
    User: matthewhorridge
    The Univeristy Of Manchester
    Medical Informatics Group
    Date: Dec 27, 2003

    matthew.horridge@cs.man.ac.uk
    www.cs.man.ac.uk/~horridgm

    The interface for a Graph. The interface defines methods for adding and removing Nodes and Edges.
    See Also:
    Node, Edge

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Edge edge)
      Adds an Edge to the graph.
      void add(Node node)
      Adds a Node to the graph.
      boolean contains(Edge edge)
      Determines if the Graph isShown the specified Edge.
      boolean contains(Node node)
      Determines if the Graph isShown the specified Node.
      int getEdgeCount()
      Returns the number of Edges that the Graph contains.
      Iterator getEdgeIterator()
      Retrieves an Iterator that can be used to traverse the Edges in the Graph.
      Edge[] getEdges()
      Gets the Edges contained in the Graph as an array.
      int getNodeCount()
      Returns the number of Nodes that the Graph contains.
      Iterator getNodeIterator()
      Retrieves an Iterator that can be used to traverse the Nodes in the Graph.
      Node[] getNodes()
      Gets the Nodes contained in the Graph as an array.
      Shape getShape()
      Gets the shape that isShown all of the Nodes and Edges belonging to the Graph.
      void remove(Edge edge)
      Removes an Edge from the Graph.
      void remove(Node node)
      Removes the specified Node from the Graph.
      void remove(Node tailNode, Node headNode)
      Removes the Edge that connects the specified Nodes (if the Nodes are contained in the Graph.
      void removeAll()
      Removes all the edges and nodes from the graph.
      void setShape(Shape shape)
      Sets the shape that describes the Graph bounds.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(Node node)
        Adds a Node to the graph. If the graph already isShown the specified node, the node is replaced with the specified node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be added.

      • remove

        void remove(Node node)
        Removes the specified Node from the Graph. Note that any edges that have this node as their head node, or tail node will also be removed.
        Parameters:
        node - The Node to be removed.

      • add

        void add(Edge edge)
        Adds an Edge to the graph. Note that the Edge will only be added if the nodes that the edge connects are contained in the graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - The Edge to be added.

      • remove

        void remove(Edge edge)
        Removes an Edge from the Graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - The Edge to be removed.

      • remove

        void remove(Node tailNode,
            Node headNode)
        Removes the Edge that connects the specified Nodes (if the Nodes are contained in the Graph.
        Parameters:
        tailNode - The Egde's tail Node.
        headNode - The Edge's head Node.

      • removeAll

        void removeAll()
        Removes all the edges and nodes from the graph.

      • getNodeCount

        int getNodeCount()
        Returns the number of Nodes that the Graph contains.
        Returns:
        The number of Nodes.

      • getEdgeCount

        int getEdgeCount()
        Returns the number of Edges that the Graph contains.
        Returns:
        The number of Edges.

      • getNodes

        Node[] getNodes()
        Gets the Nodes contained in the Graph as an array.
        Returns:
        An array containing the Nodes in the Graph.

      • getEdges

        Edge[] getEdges()
        Gets the Edges contained in the Graph as an array.
        Returns:
        An array containing the Edges in the Graph.

      • getNodeIterator

        Iterator getNodeIterator()
        Retrieves an Iterator that can be used to traverse the Nodes in the Graph.
        Returns:
        The Iterator.

      • getEdgeIterator

        Iterator getEdgeIterator()
        Retrieves an Iterator that can be used to traverse the Edges in the Graph.
        Returns:
        The Iterator.

      • getShape

        Shape getShape()
        Gets the shape that isShown all of the Nodes and Edges belonging to the Graph.
        Returns:
        A shape that describes the Graphs bounds.

      • setShape

        void setShape(Shape shape)
        Sets the shape that describes the Graph bounds.
        Parameters:
        shape - The Shape bounding the graph.

      • contains

        boolean contains(Node node)
        Determines if the Graph isShown the specified Node.
        Parameters:
        node - The Node
        Returns:
        true if the Graph isShown the Node or false if the Graph does not contain the Node.

      • contains

        boolean contains(Edge edge)
        Determines if the Graph isShown the specified Edge.
        Parameters:
        edge - The Edge.
        Returns:
        true if the Graph isShown the Edge or false if the Graph does not contain the Edge.
